title: Sound Revolution: Operly Brings its Acclaimed Intelligence III Speakers to Israel
text:
LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM, December 28, 2023 /
EINPresswire.com/ -- Operly, a company renowned for its advanced audio technology, has announced the introduction of its flagship line, the Operly Intelligence III horn loudspeakers, to the Israeli market, specifically in Tel Aviv. This marks a significant expansion for the brand, which is headquartered in London, as it brings its innovative audio solutions to a new audience.
The Operly Intelligence III is engineered for audiophiles who seek high-quality sound. This new generation of full-range speakers merges sophisticated engineering with state-of-the-art technologies. The outcome is an audio experience characterized by rich, clear sound that enhances the listening experience.
The Operly Intelligence III features a unique design and advanced technology. The speaker's monocoque body, made from high-grade fiberglass, boasts a uniform thickness of 15mm along the entire length of the backward horn. This design looks good and helps improve the speaker's sound quality.
The Operly Intelligence III incorporates both classic and innovative elements. The driver's unique design features a short coil with a small diameter and a high gap, ensuring uniformity in the magnetic field and fidelity in sound reproduction. A patented full-range horn system is another highlight, eliminating connections between the forward and backward horns. This design allows for a seamless integration of the front horn with the speaker diaphragm, enhancing the overall sound quality.
Practicality is also a key aspect of the Intelligence III's design. Its three-point support ensures stability on uneven surfaces, and its dimensions are optimized for minimal space occupation while providing an optimal listening experience. The backward horn is angled to create a comfortable listening zone at a distance of 2.7 meters, and the design also addresses the issue of standing waves by angling the sides of the horn to avoid parallel surfaces.
The Operly Intelligence III's high sensitivity audio system creates an immersive listening experience, akin to being in a symphony hall. This allows for clear conversation even at high playback volumes, making it ideal for various settings.
Customers can personalize their Operly Intelligence III speakers with a wide range of finishes, including options from the German automotive color palette, allowing for a perfect match with any interior design.
Konstantin Neymark, the founder of Operly, commented on the launch: "You are used to a narrow throat horn, but we have implemented a wide throat one. And we have a different result. In our view, the wide throat horn provides the most detailed, coherent, musical, and live sound. This is the amazement of feeling live sound. Perhaps, this is the most important thing - Operly allows you to 'see with your ears...'"
It is now available for purchase, with a suggested retail price of £33,000 / €37,000 / $40,000. Customers are invited to specify their color preferences upon ordering.

title: MULTAS PLAYAS | Estas son las playas libres de humos en Andalucía y las multas que puedes tener por fumar
text: Cada vez hay más playas en España que se han declarado libres de humo. La prohibición del tabaco en algunas zonas se ha multiplicado en solo diez años. Si en 2014 eran 15 las playas en España que optaban por prohibir fumar, apenas el 0,5% del total, este 2024 son 703 las que han colgado este cartel de no al tabaco. Los datos los ofrece la organización nofumadores.org , Por el derecho a vivir sin el humo del tabaco, que ha colgado un listado de todas las playas del país donde echar un cigarrillo tras el baño no es posible. Las multas van desde los 400 euros en Gran Canaria a los 30 euros de Barcelona. El covid sirvió a muchos ayuntamientos para estrenarse en la prohibición de humo incluso en los lugares públicos abiertos. Desde entonces cada vez se reservan más espacios para quienes quieran disfrutar del día de playa sin tragar el humo del vecino. En Andalucía se ha pasado de 48 playas donde existía la prohibición de fumar en 2021 a 57 este año. Por provincias, es en Cádiz, seguida de Málaga, donde más espacios hay con el cartel de rechazo a los cigarrillos. Según afirma la organización SEO Birdlife, las colillas en la arena de la playa o flotando en el agua son un grave problema. Este residuo es el principal contaminante que encontramos en nuestras playas y océanos y el segundo más abundante en ríos y embalses. El informe de Ocean Conservancy demuestra que las colillas contaminan los océanos tanto como los plásticos y que su presencia está por encima de residuos como envoltorios, botellas, tapones y bolsas de plástico. No solo contaminan las aguas, también son ingeridas por error por los peces y otros animales. Las colillas poseen acetosa de celulosa, en esencia una forma de plástico, que resulta muy perjudicial para el medio ambiente. Tardan en descomponerse y, cuando lo hacen, liberan las sustancias contaminantes que han absorbido del humo: nicotina, arsénico, plomo… Cada colilla tarda hasta 15 años en descomponerse y puede contaminar hasta 8 y 10 litros de agua de mar. En Almería se restringe el humo de cigarrillos o vapers en un total de nueve playas: San Nicolás (Adra), El Palmeral (Almería), Pozo del Esparto y Quitapellejos-Palomares (Cuevas de Almanzora), Cala Marqués, El Playazo, Las Marinas-Bolaga y Puerto Rey (Vera); San José, aunque en este caso hay dudas de que se mantenga este verano. En Cádiz son 24 las playas sin humo. Getares (zona Antiguo Nido) y La Concha (Algeciras); Playa interior artificial Santiscal (Arcos de la Frontera); Caños de la Meca, El Carmen, Zahara de los Atunes, Zahora y La Concha (Barbate); El Chorrillo y La Fontanilla (Conil de la Frontera); Playa de Levante (La Línea); La Puntilla (Puerto de Santa María); La Cachucha y La Ministra y el Conchal (Puerto Real); Bonanza, Bajo Guía, Calzada-Piletas y Jara (Sanlúcar de Barrameda); Atlanterra, Bolonia, Playa Chica, Lances Sur y Norte y Valdevaqueros (Tarifa); El Palmar (Vejer de la Frontera) y Playa interior Área Recreativa Arroyo Molinos (Zahara de la Sierra). En Córdoba el ayuntamiento de Almodóvar del Río prohíbe el humo en la playa artificial de interior Pantano de la Breña II y en Granada, es en Motril, en Playa Granada, en concreto en la zona Villastrida: franja de 500 metros entre Villa Astrida y el club Los Moriscos, al inicio de la playa, donde no se consumir cigarrillos. En Huelva, son playas libres de humo Isla Canela (Ayamonte), Isla Cristina, desde el acceso Casita Azul a Levante hasta Escuela de Kitesurf, Poniente (La Antilla) en Lepe y la playa del Albergue (Punta Umbría). En la provincia malagueña, hay 18 playas declaradas libres de humo. Playa Algarrobo (Algarrobo); La Rada (Estepona); Playa El Faro y Playa de San Pedro de Alcántara (Marbella); La Luna en Calahonda, El Bombo y La Cala (Mijas); Cenicero, Ferrara y Morche (Torrox) y Almayate, Benajarafe, Caleta, Lagos, Mezquitilla, Torre del Mar y Valle Niza (Velez-Málaga).

title: Look up! Northern lights putting on a show, even in New Jersey
text: Look up! Northern lights putting on a show, even in New Jersey 1-minute read A [geomagnetic storm](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/10/10/where-to-see-northern-lights-thursday-solar-storm/75604973007/) forecasted for parts of the country on Thursday and Friday night is resulting in a majestic display of colors in the night sky. There were reports of northern lights being seen all over New Jersey on Thursday. The NWS in Mount Holly reported seeing the northern lights on Thursday, there were posts from all over North Jersey on social media seeing the specticle - even Gov. Phil Murphy saw them! What are the Northern Lights? A [coral mass ejection](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/news/g4-severe-storm-watch-10-11-october) (CME), which is an eruption of solar material and magnetic field, erupted from the sun on Wednesday evening and the effects may last on Thursday and Friday evening, according to the NOAA. A G4 solar storm watch was issued by the NOAA on Tuesday, the first one [since May ](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/05/10/northern-lights-aurora-when-time/73638964007/)of earlier this year. Story continues below photo gallery The green and red lights known as the aurora borealis, or Northern Lights, may be on display for states further north such as Washington, Minnesota and Wisconsin. Even though New Jersey is not listed, some residents from the Garden State were able to see the[ Northern Lights this past week ](https://www.northjersey.com/story/news/new-jersey/2024/10/08/northern-lights-new-jersey-sightings-reported-around-state/75574696007/)before the geomagnetic storm took place. This[ past May](https://www.northjersey.com/story/news/2024/05/15/northern-lights-next-chance-to-see-aurora-borealis/73682275007/), some residents from New Jersey were lucky enough to witness the display from the last geomagnetic field. The best time to view the[ Northern Lights ](https://www.spaceweather.gov/content/tips-viewing-aurora)are typically the light night hours between 10 p.m. and 2 a.m. according to the NOAA. Those who wish to see the spectacle can have the best viewpoint with "an unobstructed view toward the north." The [New Jersey Astrology Group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/132943236702/), who reported sights on the Northern Lights earlier in the week, are posting what may be the best areas to see the aurora borealis.
